title: doubt
content: i have withdrawals from my first semester, can i clear it during second semester ESAs or is it only the next semester? because if i canâ€™t clear it this semester, i have high chances of having to repeat a year cuz of my attendance. is there anything i can do so i can write this semester exams as well like by paying a certain amount?

comments.body: If you've withdrawn a subject, you'll have to clear it in the next backlog exam. There'll be a backlog exam in May during the ESA and another one in July. I'm not sure how the new system about holding students back works because It's introduced this year, but as long as u clear your subjects in May you should be fine. I think you'll be fine if you clear it in July also, but just for safety, try to clear it during the May backlogs. Good luck :)
Does this also apply for CIE and special topic???
Special topics, yes. I'm not sure abt CIE tho
